get.summary: Returns an indexed structure of all artists.
get.description: Returns an indexed structure of all artists.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: If specified, only return artists in the music folder with the given ID. See `getMusicFolders`.

parameters.name: ifModifiedSince
parameters.description: If specified, only return a result if the artist collection has changed since the given time (in milliseconds since 1 Jan 1970).

post.summary: Returns an indexed structure of all artists.
post.description:
Returns an indexed structure of all artists.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

musicFolderId.description: If specified, only return artists in the music folder with the given ID. See `getMusicFolders`.

ifModifiedSince.description: If specified, only return a result if the artist collection has changed since the given time (in milliseconds since 1 Jan 1970).

get.summary: Searches for and returns lyrics for a given song.

get.summary: Add support for synchronized lyrics, multiple languages, and retrieval by song ID.
get.description: OpenSubsonic extension name `songLyrics` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`). Retrieves all structured lyrics from the server for a given song. The lyrics can come from embedded tags (SYLT/USLT), LRC file/text file, or any other external source.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The track ID.

post.summary: Add support for synchronized lyrics, multiple languages, and retrieval by song ID.
post.description: OpenSubsonic extension name `songLyrics` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`). Retrieves all structured lyrics from the server for a given song. The lyrics can come from embedded tags (SYLT/USLT), LRC file/text file, or any other external source.

id.description: The track ID.

get.summary: Returns the state of the play queue for this user.
get.description: Returns the state of the play queue for this user (as set by savePlayQueue). This includes the tracks in the play queue, the currently playing track, and the position within this track. Typically used to allow a user to move between different clients/apps while retaining the same play queue (for instance when listening to an audio book).

post.summary: Returns the state of the play queue for this user.
post.description:
Returns the state of the play queue for this user (as set by savePlayQueue). This includes the tracks in the play queue, the currently playing track, and the position within this track. Typically used to allow a user to move between different clients/apps while retaining the same play queue (for instance when listening to an audio book).

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

get.summary: Returns all Podcast channels the server subscribes to, and (optionally) their episodes.
get.description: Returns all Podcast channels the server subscribes to, and (optionally) their episodes. This method can also be used to return details for only one channel - refer to the id parameter. A typical use case for this method would be to first retrieve all channels without episodes, and then retrieve all episodes for the single channel the user selects.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: (Since 1.9.0) If specified, only return the Podcast channel with this ID.

parameters.name: includeEpisodes
parameters.description: (Since 1.9.0) Whether to include Podcast episodes in the returned result.

post.summary: Returns all Podcast channels the server subscribes to, and (optionally) their episodes.
post.description:
Returns all Podcast channels the server subscribes to, and (optionally) their episodes. This method can also be used to return details for only one channel - refer to the id parameter. A typical use case for this method would be to first retrieve all channels without episodes, and then retrieve all episodes for the single channel the user selects.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

id.description: (Since 1.9.0) If specified, only return the Podcast channel with this ID.

includeEpisodes.description: (Since 1.9.0) Whether to include Podcast episodes in the returned result.

parameters.name: toYear
parameters.description: Only return songs published before or in this year.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: Only return songs in the music folder with the given ID. See `getMusicFolders`.

post.summary: Returns random songs matching the given criteria.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

get.summary: Downloads a given media file (HLS).
get.description: Creates an HLS (HTTP Live Streaming) playlist used for streaming video or audio. HLS is a streaming protocol implemented by Apple and works by breaking the overall stream into a sequence of small HTTP-based file downloads. Its supported by iOS and newer versions of Android. This method also supports adaptive bitrate streaming, see the bitRate parameter.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A string which uniquely identifies the media file to stream.

parameters.name: bitRate
parameters.description: If specified, the server will attempt to limit the bitrate to this value, in kilobits per second. If this parameter is specified more than once, the server will create a variant playlist, suitable for adaptive bitrate streaming. The playlist will support streaming at all the specified bitrates. The server will automatically choose video dimensions that are suitable for the given bitrates. Since 1.9.0 you may explicitly request a certain width (480) and height (360) like so: bitRate=1000@480x360

parameters.name: audioTrack
parameters.description: The ID of the audio track to use. See `getVideoInfo` for how to get the list of available audio tracks for a video.

schema.description: Error response TODO: TO BE DESCRIBED

post.summary: Downloads a given media file (HLS).
post.description:
Creates an HLS (HTTP Live Streaming) playlist used for streaming video or audio. HLS is a streaming protocol implemented by Apple and works by breaking the overall stream into a sequence of small HTTP-based file downloads. Its supported by iOS and newer versions of Android. This method also supports adaptive bitrate streaming, see the bitRate parameter.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

id.description: A string which uniquely identifies the media file to stream.

bitRate.description: If specified, the server will attempt to limit the bitrate to this value, in kilobits per second. If set to zero, no limit is imposed.

audioTrack.description: The ID of the audio track to use. See `getVideoInfo` for how to get the list of available audio tracks for a video.

schema.description: Error response TODO: TO BE DESCRIBED

get.summary: Controls the jukebox, i.e., playback directly on the servers audio hardware.
get.description: Controls the jukebox, i.e., playback directly on the servers audio hardware. Note: The user must be authorized to control the jukebox (see Settings > Users > User is allowed to play files in jukebox mode).

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The operation to perform. Must be one of: get, status (since 1.7.0), set (since 1.7.0), start, stop, skip, add, clear, remove, shuffle, setGain

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Used by `skip` and `remove`. Zero-based index of the song to skip to or remove.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: (Since 1.7.0) Used by `skip`. Start playing this many seconds into the track.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Used by `add` and `set`. ID of song to add to the jukebox playlist. Use multiple id parameters to add many songs in the same request. (set is similar to a clear followed by a add, but will not change the currently playing track.)

parameters.name: gain
parameters.description: Used by `setGain` to control the playback volume. A float value between 0.0 and 1.0.

post.summary: Controls the jukebox, i.e., playback directly on the servers audio hardware.
post.description:
Controls the jukebox, i.e., playback directly on the servers audio hardware. Note: The user must be authorized to control the jukebox (see Settings > Users > User is allowed to play files in jukebox mode).

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

action.description: The operation to perform. Must be one of: get, status (since 1.7.0), set (since 1.7.0), start, stop, skip, add, clear, remove, shuffle, setGain

index.description: Used by `skip` and `remove`. Zero-based index of the song to skip to or remove.

offset.description: (Since 1.7.0) Used by `skip`. Start playing this many seconds into the track.

id.description: Used by `add` and `set`. ID of song to add to the jukebox playlist. Use multiple id parameters to add many songs in the same request. (set is similar to a clear followed by an add, but will not change the currently playing track.)

gain.description: Used by `setGain` to control the playback volume. A float value between 0.0 and 1.0.

get.summary: Used to test connectivity with the server.
get.description: Test connectivity with the server.

post.summary: Used to test connectivity with the server.
post.description:
Test connectivity with the server.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

get.summary: Requests the server to check for new Podcast episodes.
get.description: Requests the server to check for new Podcast episodes. Note: The user must be authorized for Podcast administration (see Settings > Users > User is allowed to administrate Podcasts).

post.summary: Requests the server to check for new Podcast episodes.
post.description:
Requests the server to check for new Podcast episodes. Note: The user must be authorized for Podcast administration (see Settings > Users > User is allowed to administrate Podcasts).

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

get.summary: Saves the state of the play queue for this user.
get.description: Saves the state of the play queue for this user. This includes the tracks in the play queue, the currently playing track, and the position within this track. Typically used to allow a user to move between different clients/apps while retaining the same play queue (for instance when listening to an audio book). `id` is optional. Send a call without any parameters to clear the currently saved queue.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of a song in the play queue. Use one id parameter for each song in the play queue.

parameters.name: current
parameters.description: The ID of the current playing song.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position in milliseconds within the currently playing song.

post.summary: Saves the state of the play queue for this user.
post.description:
Saves the state of the play queue for this user. This includes the tracks in the play queue, the currently playing track, and the position within this track. Typically used to allow a user to move between different clients/apps while retaining the same play queue (for instance when listening to an audio book). `id` is optional. Send a call without any parameters to clear the currently saved queue.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

id.description: ID of a song in the play queue. Use one id parameter for each song in the play queue.

current.description: The ID of the current playing song.

position.description: The position in milliseconds within the currently playing song.

get.summary: Registers the local playback of one or more media files.
get.description:
Registers the local playback of one or more media files. Typically used when playing media that is cached on the client. This operation includes the following:

* Scrobbles the media files on last.fm if the user has configured his/her last.fm credentials on the server.
* Updates the play count and last played timestamp for the media files. (Since 1.11.0)
* Makes the media files appear in the Now playing page in the web app, and appear in the list of songs returned by getNowPlaying (Since 1.11.0)

Since 1.8.0 you may specify multiple id (and optionally time) parameters to scrobble multiple files.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A string which uniquely identifies the file to scrobble.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: (Since 1.8.0) The time (in milliseconds since 1 Jan 1970) at which the song was listened to.

parameters.name: submission
parameters.description: Whether this is a submission or a now playing notification.

post.summary: Registers the local playback of one or more media files.
post.description:
Registers the local playback of one or more media files. Typically used when playing media that is cached on the client. This operation includes the following:

* Scrobbles the media files on last.fm if the user has configured his/her last.fm credentials on the server.
* Updates the play count and last played timestamp for the media files. (Since 1.11.0)
* Makes the media files appear in the Now playing page in the web app, and appear in the list of songs returned by getNowPlaying (Since 1.11.0)

Since 1.8.0 you may specify multiple id (and optionally time) parameters to scrobble multiple files.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

id.description: A string which uniquely identifies the file to scrobble.

time.description: (Since 1.8.0) The time (in milliseconds since 1 Jan 1970) at which the song was listened to.

submission.description: Whether this is a submission or a now playing notification.

get.summary: Returns a listing of files matching the given search criteria. Supports paging through the result.
get.description:
Deprecated since 1.4.0, use search2 instead.

Returns a listing of files matching the given search criteria. Supports paging through the result.

parameters.name: artist
parameters.description: Artist to search for.

parameters.name: album
parameters.description: Album to search for.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Song title to search for.

parameters.name: any
parameters.description: Searches all fields.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Search result offset. Used for paging.

parameters.name: newerThan
parameters.description: Only return matches that are newer than this. Given as milliseconds since 1970.

post.summary: Returns a listing of files matching the given search criteria. Supports paging through the result.
post.description:
Deprecated since 1.4.0, use search2 instead.

Returns a listing of files matching the given search criteria. Supports paging through the result.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

offset.description: Search result offset. Used for paging.

newerThan.description: Only return matches that are newer than this. Given as milliseconds since 1970.

get.summary: Returns a listing of files matching the given search criteria. Supports paging through the result. (v2)
get.description: Returns albums, artists and songs matching the given search criteria. Supports paging through the result.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query.

parameters.name: artistCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of artists to return.

parameters.name: artistOffset
parameters.description: Search result offset for artists. Used for paging.

parameters.name: albumCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of albums to return.

parameters.name: albumOffset
parameters.description: Search result offset for albums. Used for paging.

parameters.name: songCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of songs to return.

parameters.name: songOffset
parameters.description: Search result offset for songs. Used for paging.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: (Since 1.12.0) Only return albums in the music folder with the given ID. See `getMusicFolders`.

post.summary: Returns a listing of files matching the given search criteria. Supports paging through the result. (v2)
post.description:
Returns albums, artists and songs matching the given search criteria. Supports paging through the result.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

artistCount.description: Maximum number of artists to return.

artistOffset.description: Search result offset for artists. Used for paging.

albumCount.description: Maximum number of albums to return.

albumOffset.description: Search result offset for albums. Used for paging.

songCount.description: Maximum number of songs to return.

songOffset.description: Search result offset for songs. Used for paging.

musicFolderId.description: (Since 1.12.0) Only return albums in the music folder with the given ID. See `getMusicFolders`.

get.summary: Returns albums, artists and songs matching the given search criteria. Supports paging through the result. (v3)
get.description:
Returns albums, artists and songs matching the given search criteria. Supports paging through the result.

Music is organized according to ID3 tags.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query. Servers must support an empty query and return all the data to allow clients to properly access all the media information for offline sync.

parameters.name: artistCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of artists to return.

parameters.name: artistOffset
parameters.description: Search result offset for artists. Used for paging.

parameters.name: albumCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of albums to return.

parameters.name: albumOffset
parameters.description: Search result offset for albums. Used for paging.

parameters.name: songCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of songs to return.

parameters.name: songOffset
parameters.description: Search result offset for songs. Used for paging.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: (Since 1.12.0) Only return albums in the music folder with the given ID. See `getMusicFolders`.

post.summary: Returns albums, artists and songs matching the given search criteria. Supports paging through the result. (v3)
post.description:
Returns albums, artists and songs matching the given search criteria. Supports paging through the result.

Music is organized according to ID3 tags.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

query.description: Search query. Servers must support an empty query and return all the data to allow clients to properly access all the media information for offline sync.

artistCount.description: Maximum number of artists to return.

artistOffset.description: Search result offset for artists. Used for paging.

albumCount.description: Maximum number of albums to return.

albumOffset.description: Search result offset for albums. Used for paging.

songCount.description: Maximum number of songs to return.

songOffset.description: Search result offset for songs. Used for paging.

musicFolderId.description: (Since 1.12.0) Only return albums in the music folder with the given ID. See `getMusicFolders`.

get.summary: Sets the rating for a music file.
get.description: Sets the rating for a music file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A string which uniquely identifies the file (song) or folder (album/artist) to rate.

parameters.name: rating
parameters.description: The rating between 1 and 5 (inclusive), or 0 to remove the rating.

post.summary: Sets the rating for a music file.
post.description:
Sets the rating for a music file.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

id.description: A string which uniquely identifies the file (song) or folder (album/artist) to rate.

rating.description: The rating between 1 and 5 (inclusive), or 0 to remove the rating.

get.summary: Attaches a star to a song, album or artist.
get.description: Attaches a star to a song, album or artist.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the file (song) or folder (album/artist) to star. Multiple parameters allowed.

parameters.name: albumId
parameters.description: The ID of an album to star. Use this rather than `id` if the client accesses the media collection according to ID3 tags rather than file structure. Multiple parameters allowed.

parameters.name: artistId
parameters.description: The ID of an artist to star. Use this rather than `id` if the client accesses the media collection according to ID3 tags rather than file structure. Multiple parameters allowed.

post.summary: Attaches a star to a song, album or artist.
post.description:
Attaches a star to a song, album or artist.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

id.description: The ID of the file (song) or folder (album/artist) to star. Multiple parameters allowed.

albumId.description: The ID of an album to star. Use this rather than `id` if the client accesses the media collection according to ID3 tags rather than file structure. Multiple parameters allowed.

artistId.description: The ID of an artist to star. Use this rather than `id` if the client accesses the media collection according to ID3 tags rather than file structure. Multiple parameters allowed.

get.summary: Initiates a rescan of the media libraries.
get.description: Initiates a rescan of the media libraries. Takes no extra parameters.

post.summary: Initiates a rescan of the media libraries.
post.description:
Initiates a rescan of the media libraries. Takes no extra parameters.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

get.summary: Streams a given media file.
get.description:
Streams a given media file.

OpenSubsonic servers must not count access to this endpoint as a play and increase playcount. Clients can use the Scrobble endpoint to indicate that a media is played ensuring proper data in all cases.

If the server support the Transcode Offet extension, then it must accept the timeOffset parameter for music too.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A string which uniquely identifies the file to stream. Obtained by calls to getMusicDirectory.

parameters.name: maxBitRate
parameters.description: (Since 1.2.0) If specified, the server will attempt to limit the bitrate to this value, in kilobits per second. If set to zero, no limit is imposed.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: (Since 1.6.0) Specifies the preferred target format (e.g., mp3 or flv) in case there are multiple applicable transcodings. Starting with 1.9.0 you can use the special value raw to disable transcoding.

parameters.name: timeOffset
parameters.description: By default only applicable to video streaming. If specified, start streaming at the given offset (in seconds) into the media. The `Transcode Offset` extension enables the parameter to music too.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: (Since 1.6.0) Only applicable to video streaming. Requested video size specified as WxH, for instance 640x480.

parameters.name: estimateContentLength
parameters.description: (Since 1.8.0). If set to true, the Content-Length HTTP header will be set to an estimated value for transcoded or downsampled media.

parameters.name: converted
parameters.description: (Since 1.14.0) Only applicable to video streaming. Servers can optimize videos for streaming by converting them to MP4. If a conversion exists for the video in question, then setting this parameter to true will cause the converted video to be returned instead of the original.

post.summary: Streams a given media file.
post.description:
Streams a given media file.

OpenSubsonic servers must not count access to this endpoint as a play and increase playcount. Clients can use the Scrobble endpoint to indicate that a media is played ensuring proper data in all cases.

If the server supports the Transcode Offset extension, then it must accept the timeOffset parameter for music too.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

id.description: A string which uniquely identifies the file to stream. Obtained by calls to getMusicDirectory.

maxBitRate.description: (Since 1.2.0) If specified, the server will attempt to limit the bitrate to this value, in kilobits per second. If set to zero, no limit is imposed.

format.description: (Since 1.6.0) Specifies the preferred target format (e.g., mp3 or flv) in case there are multiple applicable transcodings. Starting with 1.9.0 you can use the special value raw to disable transcoding.

timeOffset.description: By default only applicable to video streaming. If specified, start streaming at the given offset (in seconds) into the media. The `Transcode Offset` extension enables the parameter to music too.

size.description: (Since 1.6.0) Only applicable to video streaming. Requested video size specified as WxH, for instance 640x480.

estimateContentLength.description: (Since 1.8.0). If set to true, the Content-Length HTTP header will be set to an estimated value for transcoded or downsampled media.

converted.description: (Since 1.14.0) Only applicable to video streaming. Servers can optimize videos for streaming by converting them to MP4. If a conversion exists for the video in question, then setting this parameter to true will cause the converted video to be returned instead of the original.

get.summary: Returns information about an API key
get.description: OpenSubsonic extension name `apiKeyAuthentication` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`). Returns data about an API key.

post.summary: Returns information about an API key
post.description: OpenSubsonic extension name `apiKeyAuthentication` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`). Returns data about an API key.

get.summary: Removes a star to a song, album or artist.
get.description: Removes a star to a song, album or artist.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the file (song) or folder (album/artist) to star. Multiple parameters allowed.

parameters.name: albumId
parameters.description: The ID of an album to star. Use this rather than `id` if the client accesses the media collection according to ID3 tags rather than file structure. Multiple parameters allowed.

parameters.name: artistId
parameters.description: The ID of an artist to star. Use this rather than `id` if the client accesses the media collection according to ID3 tags rather than file structure. Multiple parameters allowed.

post.summary: Removes a star to a song, album or artist.
post.description:
Removes a star to a song, album or artist.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

albumId.description: The ID of an album to unstar. Use this rather than `id` if the client accesses the media collection according to ID3 tags rather than file structure. Multiple parameters allowed.

artistId.description: The ID of an artist to unstar. Use this rather than `id` if the client accesses the media collection according to ID3 tags rather than file structure. Multiple parameters allowed.

get.summary: Updates an existing internet radio station.
get.description: Updates an existing internet radio station. Only users with admin privileges are allowed to call this method.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the station.

parameters.name: streamUrl
parameters.description: The stream URL for the station.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The user-defined name for the station.

parameters.name: homepageUrl
parameters.description: The home page URL for the station.

post.summary: Updates an existing internet radio station.
post.description:
Updates an existing internet radio station. Only users with admin privileges are allowed to call this method.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

id.description: The ID of the station.

streamUrl.description: The stream URL for the station.

name.description: The user-defined name for the station.

homepageUrl.description: The home page URL for the station.

get.summary: Updates a playlist. Only the owner of a playlist is allowed to update it.
get.description: Updates a playlist. Only the owner of a playlist is allowed to update it.

parameters.name: playlistId
parameters.description: The playlist ID.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The human-readable name of the playlist.

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: The playlist comment.

parameters.name: public
parameters.description: `true` if the playlist should be visible to all users, `false` otherwise.

parameters.name: songIdToAdd
parameters.description: Add this song with this ID to the playlist. Multiple parameters allowed.

parameters.name: songIndexToRemove
parameters.description: Remove the song at this position in the playlist. Multiple parameters allowed.

post.summary: Updates a playlist. Only the owner of a playlist is allowed to update it.
post.description:
Updates a playlist. Only the owner of a playlist is allowed to update it.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

name.description: The human-readable name of the playlist.

public.description: `true` if the playlist should be visible to all users, `false` otherwise.

songIdToAdd.description: Add this song with this ID to the playlist. Multiple parameters allowed.

songIndexToRemove.description: Remove the song at this position in the playlist. Multiple parameters allowed.

get.summary: Updates the description and/or expiration date for an existing share.
get.description: Updates the description and/or expiration date for an existing share.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the share to update.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A user-defined description that will be displayed to people visiting the shared media.

parameters.name: expires
parameters.description: The time at which the share expires. Given as milliseconds since 1970, or zero to remove the expiration.

post.summary: Updates the description and/or expiration date for an existing share.
post.description:
Updates the description and/or expiration date for an existing share.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

id.description: ID of the share to update.

description.description: A user-defined description that will be displayed to people visiting the shared media.

expires.description: The time at which the share expires. Given as milliseconds since 1970, or zero to remove the expiration.

get.summary: Modifies an existing user on the server.
get.description: Modifies an existing user on the server.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name of the user.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password of the user, either in clear text of hex-encoded (see above).

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email address of the user.

parameters.name: ldapAuthenticated
parameters.description: Whether the user is authenicated in LDAP.

parameters.name: adminRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is administrator.

parameters.name: settingsRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to change personal settings and password.

parameters.name: streamRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to play files.

parameters.name: jukeboxRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to play files in jukebox mode.

parameters.name: downloadRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to download files.

parameters.name: uploadRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to upload files.

parameters.name: coverArtRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to change cover art and tags.

parameters.name: commentRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to create and edit comments and ratings.

parameters.name: podcastRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to administrate Podcasts.

parameters.name: shareRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to share files with anyone.

parameters.name: videoConversionRole
parameters.description: (Since 1.15.0) Whether the user is allowed to start video conversions.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: (Since 1.12.0) IDs of the music folders the user is allowed access to. Include the parameter once for each folder.

parameters.name: maxBitRate
parameters.description: (Since 1.13.0) The maximum bit rate (in Kbps) for the user. Audio streams of higher bit rates are automatically downsampled to this bit rate. Legal values: 0 (no limit), 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 80, 96, 112, 128, 160, 192, 224, 256, 320.

post.summary: Modifies an existing user on the server.
post.description:
Modifies an existing user on the server.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

password.description: The password of the user, either in clear text or hex-encoded.

email.description: The email address of the user.

ldapAuthenticated.description: Whether the user is authenticated in LDAP.

adminRole.description: Whether the user is an administrator.

settingsRole.description: Whether the user is allowed to change personal settings and password.

streamRole.description: Whether the user is allowed to play files.

jukeboxRole.description: Whether the user is allowed to play files in jukebox mode.

downloadRole.description: Whether the user is allowed to download files.

uploadRole.description: Whether the user is allowed to upload files.

coverArtRole.description: Whether the user is allowed to change cover art and tags.

commentRole.description: Whether the user is allowed to create and edit comments and ratings.

podcastRole.description: Whether the user is allowed to administrate Podcasts.

shareRole.description: Whether the user is allowed to share files with anyone.

videoConversionRole.description: (Since 1.15.0) Whether the user is allowed to start video conversions.

musicFolderId.description: (Since 1.12.0) IDs of the music folders the user is allowed access to. Include the parameter once for each folder.

maxBitRate.description: (Since 1.13.0) The maximum bit rate (in Kbps) for the user. Audio streams of higher bit rates are automatically downsampled to this bit rate. Legal values: 0 (no limit), 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 80, 96, 112, 128, 160, 192, 224, 256, 320.

f.name: f
f.description: The response format. Must be 'xml' or 'json'. For the purposes of this document, only `json` is allowed.

apiKeyAuth.name: apiKey
apiKeyAuth.description: [OS] An API key used for authentication. If specified, `p`, `t`, `s` nor `u` can be specified.

legacyPassword.name: p
legacyPassword.description: The password, either in clear text or hex-encoded with a enc: prefix. Since 1.13.0 this should only be used for testing purposes. `u` must be specified.

token.name: t
token.description: (Since 1.13.0) The authentication token computed as md5(password + salt). `u` and `s` must be specified. See https://opensubsonic.netlify.app/docs/api-reference/#authentication for details.

salt.name: s
salt.description: (Since 1.13.0) A random string (salt) used as input for computing the password hash. `u` and `t` must be specified. See https://opensubsonic.netlify.app/docs/api-reference/#authentication for details.

protocolVersion.name: v
protocolVersion.description: The protocol version implemented by the client, i.e., the version of the subsonic-rest-api.xsd schema used (see below).

clientName.name: c
clientName.description: A unique string identifying the client application.

format.name: f
format.description: The response format. Must be 'xml' or 'json'. For the purposes of this document, only `json` is allowed.

GetIndexesResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested indexes element on success.

GetInternetRadioStationsResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested internetRadioStations element on success.

GetLicenseResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested license element on success.

GetLyricsResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested lyrics element on success.

GetLyricsBySongIdResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested lyricsList

GetMusicDirectoryResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested directory element on success.

GetMusicFoldersResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested musicFolders element on success.

GetNewestPodcastsResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `newestPodcasts` element on success.

GetNowPlayingResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `nowPlaying` element on success.

GetOpenSubsonicExtensionsResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `openSubsonicExtensions` element on success.

GetPlaylistResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested playlist element on success.

GetPlaylistsResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `playlists` element on success.

GetPlayQueueResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `playQueue` element on success.

GetPodcastEpisodeResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `podcastEpisode` element on success.

GetPodcastsResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `podcasts` element on success.

GetRandomSongsResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `randomSongs` element on success.

GetScanStatusResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `scanStatus` element on success.

GetSharesResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `shares` element on success.

GetSimilarSongsResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `similarSongs` element on success.

GetSimilarSongs2Response.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `similarSongs2` element on success.

GetSongResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `song` element on success.

GetSongsByGenreResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `songsByGenre` element on success.

GetStarredResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `starred` element on success.

GetStarred2Response.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `starred2` element on success.

GetTopSongsResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `topSongs` element on success.

GetUserResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `user` element on success.

GetUsersResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `user` element on success.

GetVideoInfoResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `videoInfo` element on success.

GetVideosResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `videos` element on success.

JukeboxControlResponse.description:
A subsonic-response element with a nested :

- jukeboxStatus for all actions but get
- jukeboxPlaylist for get action

SearchResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `searchResult` element on success.

Search2Response.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `searchResult2` element on success.

Search3Response.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `searchResult3` element on success.

StartScanResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `scanStatus` element on success.

GetTokenInfoResponse.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested tokenInfo on success, or error 44 on invalid token.
